intro: Eriophorum asiaticum, commonly known as the Asian tussock sedge, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist habitats. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. Its leaves are grass-like, and it forms tussocks, contributing to the structure of its ecosystem. Eriophorum asiaticum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
